heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.0°C), outside temperature (down 2.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 220 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 354 m) and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 220.1m lower than yesterday, 8.3m higher than the past week, 353.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1039m minimum and 2260m maximum, with an average of 1246.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1237.9m and 1600.0m.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
